intro: Theophrasta densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered theophrasta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture. Theophrasta densiflora is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in humid environments.
